Description: Syngenta Crop Protection, a pesticide manufacturer based in Greensboro, N.C., has corrected pesticide labeling violations stemming from incorrect labels it gave to a pesticide distributor in Tangent, Oregon, according to a settlement with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. Syngenta has agreed to pay a penalty of $50,100.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/a1bd726f96e6963985257cd2006308b0.html

Description: Syngenta Crop Protection LLC, of Greensboro, N.C., has agreed to pay a $102,000 civil penalty to the United States to settle a series of environmental violations related to the sale or distribution of misbranded pesticides through its facility in Omaha, Neb., and through a farm supply retailer in Savannah, Mo.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/222eb286ce26252b852579f800664769.html
https://www.fra.dot.gov/eLib/details/L04190#p1_z5_gD_lEA

Description: Syngenta Seeds, Inc.of Golden Valley, Minn., agreed to pay a $1.5 million penalty to EPA for selling and distributing seed corn that contained an unregistered genetically engineered pesticide called Bt 10.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://yosemite.epa.gov/opa/admpress.nsf/7c02ca8c86062a0f85257018004118a6/2df47c51f639be4e8525724b0069655c!OpenDocument

Description: Migrant and Seasonal Agricultural Worker Protection Act penalties included
Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 111219: Other Vegetable (except Potato) and Melon Farming
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php

Description: Syngenta agreed to pay $1.5 billion to settle multi-district litigation alleging that the introduction of its genetically modified corn caused harm to producers of non-GMO crops.
Private Litigation Case Title: In Re: Syngenta AG MIR162 Corn Litigation
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/1031957/farmers-win-ok-of-1-5b-syngenta-gmo-corn-settlement
